39         <p class="font-small">To get an Access to Work grant you must be:</p>
32         <p class="font-small" id="grant">To get an Access to Work grant you must be:</p>
4033

34         <ul class="list-bullet" aria-labelledby="grant">
4235           <li>16 or over</li>
43            <li>have a disability that makes it difficult for you to do your current job or a job you're about to start</li>
44            <li>live and work in England, Scotland or Northern Ireland</li>
36            <li>have a long term disability or health condition that makes it difficult for you to do your current job or a job you're about to start</li>
37            <li>living and working in England, Scotland or Wales</li>
4538      </ul>
4639
47       <p class="font-small">As part of the application process Department for Work & Pensions will contact your employer. Your employer could have to
48       pay some of your grant, depending on how much you get.</p>
40       <p class="font-small">Department for Work & Pensions will contact your employer when you apply. Your employer could have to pay some of your grant, depending on how much you get.</p>
4941      <p class="font-small">An assessor might have to visit you at work to make a decision.</p>

 43       <details> 
 44           <summary><span class="summary">More about long term health conditions</span></summary>

 46               <p>Your health condition or disability doesn't have to be permanent but you must either:</p> 
 47               <ul> 
 48               <li>have had it for at least a year</li> 
 49               <li>expect it to last at least another 12 months from when you apply</li> 
 50               </ul> 
 51               <p>You don't usually need to give any medical evidence of your condition as part of your application.</p>
